Day 1: Assess patient with suspected esophageal stricture - Perform esophagogastroduodenoscopy.
Week 6: Persistent rectal bleeding - Schedule colonoscopy for patient.
Day 3: Suspected case of bacterial meningitis - Conduct cerebrospinal fluid analysis via lumbar puncture.

Month 3: Monitor patient with diagnosed lymphoma - Schedule positron emission tomography scan.
Day 2: Assess patient with wrist pain after fall - Obtain wrist radiograph.

Day 14: Follow-up for patient with family history of colorectal cancer - Arrange colonoscopy.
